response:
Urgent neuroimaging is required to confirm stroke and identify large-vessel occlusion or aneurysm. Cardiac work-up looks for embolic sources. Blood tests evaluate contraindications to reperfusion and vascular risk. Ophthalmic assessment clarifies the RAPD/optic pathway involvement.

investigations = ["Non-contrast CT Brain", "CT Angiogram of Head and Neck", "MRI Brain with diffusion- and susceptibility-weighted sequences", "MR Angiography of Head and Neck", "ECG", "Inpatient cardiac telemetry", "Transthoracic echocardiogram (with bubble study if cryptogenic)", "Full blood count", "Urea and electrolytes", "Coagulation screen", "Blood glucose", "HbA1c", "Lipid profile", "High-sensitivity troponin", "ESR", "CRP", "Comprehensive ophthalmic assessment including visual fields and dilated fundus examination", "Digital subtraction angiography (if aneurysm suspected or for endovascular therapy)"]
